title.value: Vital Records Mortality and Morbidity Reporting FHIR Implementation Guide

name.value: Hetty Khan, Health Scientist (Informatics), CDC/National Center for Health Statistics - hdk1@cdc.gov
AbdulMalik Shakir, FHL7, President and Chief Informatics Scientist Hi3 Solutions - abdulmalik.shakir@hi3solutions.com

description.value:
The VRDR FHIR IG provides guidance regarding the use of FHIR resources as a conduit for data required in the bidirectional exchange of mortality data between State-run Public Health Agencies (PHA) Vital Records offices and U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)/National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS).
Bidirectional exchange of mortality data between PHA Vital Records offices and NCHS is essential to effective public health surveillance and emergency response efforts. Automation of the reporting process adds efficiencies that dramatically improves the efficacy of event response, data analysis, and evidence-based measurable prevention of the causes of death.
The VRDR FHIR IG will provide guidance for the use of standard FHIR resources as a conduit for data required by vital records death reporting. The use of FHIR as a platform for automation of vital records death reporting is expected to improve existing automation by enabling wide-scale adoption and leveraging the potential of electronic health records and clinical decision support systems.
The VRDR FHIR IG will lay a foundation for expansion of automated standards-driven information exchange to include tributary flows of information from entities such as physicians, medical examiners, coroners, funeral directors, and family members to public health agencies and between public health agencies and secondary users of detailed mortality data and aggregate statistics.

Decedent Demographics is a profile group comprised of profiles containing decedent demographic data. Demographic data includes information about related persons (Mother, Father, and Spouse) and social determinants such as education level and usual occupation. The information in this profile group are provided by a decedent informant.

Death Investigation is a profile group comprised of profiles containing data obtained during the course of investigating a death. Many of these items are conditionally present in a death certification transaction depending on whether or not a autopsy was performed, an injury incident occurred, or a transportation event was involved.

Death Certification is a profile group comprised of profiles containing data related to the primary concern of the VRDR IG, Death Certification. In this group the causes of death and the causal pathway are documented and attested to by a death certifier (coroner or medical examiner).

Decedent Disposition is a profile group comprised of profiles containing data related to the disposition of the decedents remains. The data in this profile group is typically provided by the funeral home performing the disposition services. The content of this profile group is authenticated by the funeral home director.
The decedent resource represents the deceased person that is the subject of the vital record death report. The VRDR Decedent profile builds upon the US-Core Patient profile.

The Decedent Age resource represents the decedent's chronological age at the time of death. Age is derived as the difference in time between the decedent's death date and birth date. The VRDR Decedent Age profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation Resource.
The Decedent's Education Level resource represents the highest level of education achieved by the decedent. The VRDR Decedent's Education Level profile builds upon the FHIR Observation resource.

The Examiner Contacted resource represents an indication as to whether a medical examiner (or coroner) was contacted to conduct an investigation and certify the causes of death. The VRDR Examiner Contacted profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.
The Disposition Location resource represents the place/location where the decedent's remains were disposed of. The VRDR Disposition Location profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Location resource.
The Decedent's Mother resource represents the maternal parent of the decedent. The VRDR Decedent Mother profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Related Person resource.
The Decedent Pregnancy resource provides an indication of the pregnancy status of the decedent. The VRDR Decedent Pregnancy profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.
The Decedent Spouse resource represents the surviving spouse of the decedent. The VRDR Decedent Spouse profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Related Person resource.

The Decedent Transportation Role resource is used to specify the role of the decedent (e.g. driver, passenger, pedestrian, other) in a transportation-related injury. The VRDR Decedent Transportation Role profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

The Funeral Home resource represents the business entity conducting ceremony connected with the final disposition of the decedent's remains, such as a burial or cremation, with the attendant observances. The VRDR Funeral Home profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Organization resource.

The Interested Party resource represents a business entity that assigns one or more identifiers to a death certificate document. Assigning authorities for death certificate identifiers include coroners and medical examiners, local and state public health agencies, and the national center for health statistics. The VRDR Interested Party profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Organization resource.

The Manner of Death resource represents the conclusion arrived at upon completion of death investigation regarding the manner of death (eg., natural, homicide, suicide, accident, ...). The VRDR Manner of Death profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

The Mortician resource represents the professional practitioner preceding over the funeral services involved in the disposition of the decedent's remains. The VRDR Mortician profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Practitioner resource.

The Tobacco Use Contributed To Death resource represents the conclusion arrived at during death investigation regarding the extent to which tobacco use contributed to the death of the decedent. The VRDR Tobacco Use Contributed To Death profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

The Injury Location resource represents the general place (such as restaurant, vacant lot, or home) where a decedent's death-related injury occurred. The VRDR Injury Location profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Location resource.

The Autopsy Performed Indicator profile provides an indication as to whether an autopsy was performed and if so, indicates whether the results of the autopsy are available. The Autopsy Performed Indicator profile builds upon the FHIR Observation resource.

The Cause Of Death Condition resource represents a clinically relevant condition --disease, injury, or complication-- in the causal pathway of events that directly caused the death. The VRDR Cause of Death Condition profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Condition resource.

The Certifier resource represents the practitioner (coroner, medical examiner, or physician) who certifies death, the manner of death, and the causes of death. The VRDR Cerfifier profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Practitioner resource.

The Condition Contributing To Death resource represents a significant condition contributing to death but not resulting in the underlying cause. The VRDR Condition Contributing To Death profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Condition resource.

The Death Certificate resource represents the body of the death certificate document that lays in order to the bundle of resources comprising the death certificate document. The VRDR Death Certificate profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Composition resource.
The Death Certificate Document resource is the bundle of resources that comprise the death certificate. The VRDR Death Certificate Document profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Bundle resource.
The Death Certification resource represents the act of certifying death. The VRDR Death Certification profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Procedure resource.
The Death Location resource represents the decedent's place of death. The VRDR Death Location profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Location resource.

The Death Pronouncement Performer resource represents the health practitioner that declared the decedent dead. The VRDR Death Pronouncement Performer profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Practitioner resouce.

The Within City Limits Indicator resource is an extension to the FHIR Address Datatype. It is used to indicate if the decedent's residential address is a location within the limits of the address city.

The Injury Incident resource represents observations (time, location, and work or transportation-related), discovered regarding an injury event during a death investigation. The VRDR Injury Incident profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.
The Birth Record Identifier resource is a reference to a birth record used as a linkage. The VRDR Birth Record Identifier profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

The Cause of Death Pathway resource documents the ordered chain conditions in the causal pathway chain of events with a causal relationship to the decedent's death. The VRDR Cause of Death Pathway profile builds upon the FHIR R4 List resource.

The Death Certificate Reference resource enables interested parties to assign local identifiers to the death certificate document. The Death Certificate Reference profile builds upon the FHIR Document Reference resource.

The Decedent Disposition Method resource specifies the means by which the decedent's remains were disposed of. The VRDR Decedent Disposition Method profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

The Death Date resource is used to convey the actual or presumed date of death for the decedent. If the date of death unable to be determined then the date the decedent's remains were discovered serves as a surrogate for the death date. The VRDR Death Date resource profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource. The date the decedent was pronounced dead is included as a component of the death date observation.

The Decedent Usual Work resource is used to convey the usual work industry and occupation of the decedent. The base profile is lifted directly out of the Occupational Data for Health (ODH), Release 1.0 FHIR Implementation Guide (http://hl7.org/fhir/us/odh/).
The Decedent Military Service resource is used to convey whether the decedent was ever in the US armed forces. The VRDR Decedent Military Service profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.
The Funeral Service Licensee resource is used to convey the role of the funeral home mortician responsible for the decedents funeral service.
